attributes.action: reject the censorship of video games and films for adults.  We support the British Board of Film Classification (BBFC) age rating systems so that children are protected but over 18s should have the right to choose what games they play and what films they watch.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It is entirely unreasonable for the British Board of Film Classification to have the power to prevent adults from viewing certain pieces of entertainment.  All adults are mature enough to make decisions for themselves regarding how they want to be entertained.  Removing the right of adults to choose which films and videogames they wish to experience is a gross affront to civil liberties and is an insult to the intelligence of every adult in this country.  Adults should be free to make their own informed decisions about what types of entertainment they view.”
